  <script>
    (function () {
      const generateUUID = () =>
        "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx".replace(/[xy]/g, function (c) {
          const r = (Math.random() * 16) | 0;
          const v = c === "x" ? r : (r & 0x3) | 0x8;
          return v.toString(16);
        });
  
      let isLocalStorageAvailable = false;
      const isAvailable = () => {
        if (isLocalStorageAvailable) {
          return true;
        }
  
        try {
          const x = "__storage_test__";
          window.localStorage.setItem(x, x);
          window.localStorage.removeItem(x);
          isLocalStorageAvailable = true;
          return true;
        } catch (e) {
          return false;
        }
      };
  
      const unsafeSetItem = (key, value) => {
        window.localStorage.setItem(key, JSON.stringify(value));
      };
  
      const unsafeGetItem = (key) => {
        return JSON.parse(window.localStorage.getItem(key) || "null");
      };
  
      const setSafeItem = (key, value) => {
        if (isAvailable()) {
          unsafeSetItem(key, value);
        }
      };
  
      const getSafeItem = (key, defaultValue) => {
        return isAvailable() ? unsafeGetItem(key) : defaultValue;
      };
  
      const ANA_UID_KEY = "ana_uid";
      let currentUid = getSafeItem(ANA_UID_KEY, "");
      if (!currentUid) {
        currentUid = generateUUID();
        setSafeItem(ANA_UID_KEY, currentUid);
      }
      window.getAnaUid = () => currentUid;
    })();
  </script>

  <script>
  function initialize_wunderkind(d) {
    window.addEventListener('load', function() {
      var e = d.createElement('script');
      e.src = d.location.protocol + '//tag.wknd.ai/5453/i.js';
      e.async = true;
      d.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e);
    });
  }

  function determine_wunderkind_eligibility() {
    if (window.location.search.includes('enable_wunderkind')) {
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
      return;
    }

    let wunderkind_segment = 0;
    try { wunderkind_segment = localStorage.getItem('genius_wunderkind_segment'); } catch (e) {}

    if (typeof(wunderkind_segment) === 'string') {
      wunderkind_segment = Number(wunderkind_segment);
    } else {
      wunderkind_segment = Math.random();
      try { localStorage.setItem('genius_wunderkind_segment', wunderkind_segment); } catch (e) {}
    }

    if ((wunderkind_segment * 100) < 100.0) {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'wunderkind';
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
    } else {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'control';
    }
  }

  determine_wunderkind_eligibility();
</script>

class="About__Container-ut4i9m-1 eSiFpi"><h1 font-size="xxLargeHeadline" class="About__Title-ut4i9m-2 WryoK">About</h1><div class="SongDescription__Container-sc-615rvk-0 ccTbRB"><div class="Attribution__Container-sc-1nmry9o-0 cjDZYo"><div class="Attribution__Header-sc-1nmry9o-1 iPNsXE"><span>Genius Annotation</span><button text-decoration="underline" type="button" class="TextButton-sc-192nsqv-0 ixMmYX">18 contributors</button></div></div><div class="ExpandableContent__Container-sc-1165iv-0 ikywhQ"><div class="ExpandableContent__Content-sc-1165iv-4 huhsMa"><div class="SongDescription__Content-sc-615rvk-2 kRzyD"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 frEqiL"><p>In this song, Eminem corresponds with a crazed fan who becomes increasingly unhinged as the story progresses. This is one of his most well-received singles and was listed at #15 on <a href="http://www.vh1.com/" rel="noopener nofollow">VH1</a>â€™s <a href="http://ifelicious.com/2008/09/25/vh-1s-list-of-top-100-hip-hop-songs-of-all-time/" rel="noopener nofollow">Top 100 Hip Hop Songs of All Time</a>.</p>

<p>Eminem intended for this song to be <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2R6yvdKPqA" rel="noopener nofollow">a message to fans</a> who had written him disturbing letters indicating that they had taken <a href="https://genius.com/albums/Eminem/The-slim-shady-lp-expanded-edition" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/506752"><em>The Slim Shady LP</em></a>â€™s violent lyrics seriously. Another reason Em wrote this was to <a href="https://youtu.be/AwLQxWiOTEI" rel="noopener nofollow">â€œmake the critics who were saying things about [him] feel stupid.â€</a> His aim was to disprove those who felt he lacked talent and relied on shock value.</p>

<p>This song has cemented itself in history, with â€œStanâ€ being entered into the <a href="http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/stan" rel="noopener nofollow">Oxford Dictionary</a> as an informal noun. It is generally considered to be a portmanteau of â€œstalkerâ€ and â€œfan,â€ but Oxford defines the term as:</p>

<blockquote><p>An overzealous or obsessive fan of a particular celebrity.</p></blockquote>

<p>In a 2011 <a href="https://m.siriusxm.com/shade45" rel="noopener nofollow">Shade 45</a> appearance, Em <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p_x0KBndWDI" rel="noopener nofollow">revealed that</a>:</p>

<blockquote><p>There was a verse where [Stan] got out of the water. He escaped and came to my house to kill me. Then I had to kill him first, [but] I missed him, and he was in the hospital for like three weeks. Then he was pissed off that I didnâ€™t write him get-well cards, so he came to kill me again, and in the last verse finally I just blew his head off.</p></blockquote>

<p>In 2013, Eminem released a follow-up in the form of <a href="https://genius.com/Eminem-bad-guy-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/235723">â€œBad Guy,â€</a> wherein Stanâ€™s younger brother Matthew avenges his brotherâ€™s death.</p></div></div></div><div class="ExpandableContent__ButtonContainer-sc-1165iv-3 htndFn"><button class="Button__Container-rtu9rw-0 gZBeJn this song, Eminem corresponds with a crazed fan who becomes increasingly unhinged as the story progresses. This is one of his most well-received singles and was listed at #15 on [VH1](http://www.vh1.com)\'s [Top 100 Hip Hop Songs of All Time](http://ifelicious.com/2008/09/25/vh-1s-list-of-top-100-hip-hop-songs-of-all-time/).\\n\\nEminem intended for this song to be [a message to fans](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2R6yvdKPqA) who had written him disturbing letters indicating that they had taken [*The Slim Shady LP*](https://genius.com/albums/Eminem/The-slim-shady-lp-expanded-edition)\'s violent lyrics seriously. Another reason Em wrote this was to [\\\"make the critics who were saying things about [him] feel stupid.\\\"](https://youtu.be/AwLQxWiOTEI) His aim was to disprove those who felt he lacked talent and relied on shock value.\\n\\nThis song has cemented itself in history, with \\\"Stan\\\" being entered into the [Oxford Dictionary](http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/stan) as an informal noun. It is generally considered to be a portmanteau of \\\"stalker\\\" and \\\"fan,\\\" but Oxford defines the term as:\\n\\n>An overzealous or obsessive fan of a particular celebrity.\\n\\nIn a 2011 [Shade 45](https://m.siriusxm.com/shade45) appearance, Em [revealed that](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p_x0KBndWDI):\\n\\n> There was a verse where [Stan] got out of the water. He escaped and came to my house to kill me. Then I had to kill him first, [but] I missed him, and he was in the hospital for like three weeks. Then he was pissed off that I didn\'t write him get-well cards, so he came to kill me again, and in the last verse finally I just blew his head off.\\n\\nIn 2013, Eminem released a follow-up in the form of [\\\"Bad Guy,\\\"](http://genius.com/Eminem-bad-guy-lyrics) wherein Stan\'s younger brother Matthew avenges his brother\'s death.\",\"html\":\"<p>In this song, Eminem corresponds with a crazed fan who becomes increasingly unhinged as the story progresses. This is one of his most well-received singles and was listed at #15 on <a href=\\\"http://www.vh1.com/\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">VH1<\/a>â€™s <a href=\\\"http://ifelicious.com/2008/09/25/vh-1s-list-of-top-100-hip-hop-songs-of-all-time/\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">Top 100 Hip Hop Songs of All Time<\/a>.<\/p>\\n\\n<p>Eminem intended for this song to be <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2R6yvdKPqA\\\" rel=\\\"noopener nofollow\\\">a message to fans<\/a> who had written him disturbing letters indicating that they had taken <a href=\\\"https://genius.com/albums/Eminem/The-slim-shady-lp-expanded-edition\\\" rel=\\\"noopener\\\" data-api_path=\\\"/albums/506752\\\"><em>The Slim Shady LP<\/em><\/a>â€™s violent lyrics seriously.       const generateUUID = () =>

          const r = (Math.random() * 16) | 0;
          const v = c === "x" ? r : (r & 0x3) | 0x8;
          return v.toString(16);
        });
  
      let isLocalStorageAvailable = false;
      const isAvailable = () => {
        if (isLocalStorageAvailable) {
          return true;
        }
  
        try {
          const x = "__storage_test__";
          window.localStorage.setItem(x, x);
          window.localStorage.removeItem(x);
          isLocalStorageAvailable = true;
          return true;
        } catch (e) {
          return false;
        }
      };
  
      const unsafeSetItem = (key, value) => {
        window.localStorage.setItem(key, JSON.stringify(value));
      };
  
      const unsafeGetItem = (key) => {
        return JSON.parse(window.localStorage.getItem(key) || "null");
      };
  
      const setSafeItem = (key, value) => {
        if (isAvailable()) {
          unsafeSetItem(key, value);
        }
      };
  
      const getSafeItem = (key, defaultValue) => {
        return isAvailable() ? unsafeGetItem(key) : defaultValue;
      };
  
      const ANA_UID_KEY = "ana_uid";
      let currentUid = getSafeItem(ANA_UID_KEY, "");
      if (!currentUid) {
        currentUid = generateUUID();
        setSafeItem(ANA_UID_KEY, currentUid);
      }
      window.getAnaUid = () => currentUid;
    })();
  </script>

  <script>
  function initialize_wunderkind(d) {
    window.addEventListener('load', function() {
      var e = d.createElement('script');
      e.src = d.location.protocol + '//tag.wknd.ai/5453/i.js';
      e.async = true;
      d.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(e);
    });
  }

  function determine_wunderkind_eligibility() {
    if (window.location.search.includes('enable_wunderkind')) {
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
      return;
    }

    let wunderkind_segment = 0;
    try { wunderkind_segment = localStorage.getItem('genius_wunderkind_segment'); } catch (e) {}

    if (typeof(wunderkind_segment) === 'string') {
      wunderkind_segment = Number(wunderkind_segment);
    } else {
      wunderkind_segment = Math.random();
      try { localStorage.setItem('genius_wunderkind_segment', wunderkind_segment); } catch (e) {}
    }

    if ((wunderkind_segment * 100) < 100.0) {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'wunderkind';
      initialize_wunderkind(document);
    } else {
      window['com.Genius.wunderkind_cohort'] = 'control';
    }
  }

  determine_wunderkind_eligibility();
</script>

class="SongDescription__Content-sc-615rvk-2 kRzyD"><div class="RichText__Container-oz284w-0 frEqiL"><p>In this song, Eminem corresponds with a crazed fan who becomes increasingly unhinged as the story progresses. This is one of his most well-received singles and was listed at #15 on <a href="http://www.vh1.com/" rel="noopener nofollow">VH1</a>â€™s <a href="http://ifelicious.com/2008/09/25/vh-1s-list-of-top-100-hip-hop-songs-of-all-time/" rel="noopener nofollow">Top 100 Hip Hop Songs of All Time</a>.</p>

<p>Eminem intended for this song to be <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2R6yvdKPqA" rel="noopener nofollow">a message to fans</a> who had written him disturbing letters indicating that they had taken <a href="https://genius.com/albums/Eminem/The-slim-shady-lp-expanded-edition" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/albums/506752"><em>The Slim Shady LP</em></a>â€™s violent lyrics seriously. Another reason Em wrote this was to <a href="https://youtu.be/AwLQxWiOTEI" rel="noopener nofollow">â€œmake the critics who were saying things about [him] feel stupid.â€</a> His aim was to disprove those who felt he lacked talent and relied on shock value.</p>

<p>This song has cemented itself in history, with â€œStanâ€ being entered into the <a href="http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/stan" rel="noopener nofollow">Oxford Dictionary</a> as an informal noun. It is generally considered to be a portmanteau of â€œstalkerâ€ and â€œfan,â€ but Oxford defines the term as:</p>

<blockquote><p>An overzealous or obsessive fan of a particular celebrity.</p></blockquote>

<p>In a 2011 <a href="https://m.siriusxm.com/shade45" rel="noopener nofollow">Shade 45</a> appearance, Em <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p_x0KBndWDI" rel="noopener nofollow">revealed that</a>:</p>

<blockquote><p>There was a verse where [Stan] got out of the water. He escaped and came to my house to kill me. Then I had to kill him first, [but] I missed him, and he was in the hospital for like three weeks. Then he was pissed off that I didnâ€™t write him get-well cards, so he came to kill me again, and in the last verse finally I just blew his head off.</p></blockquote>

<p>In 2013, Eminem released a follow-up in the form of <a href="https://genius.com/Eminem-bad-guy-lyrics" rel="noopener" data-api_path="/songs/235723">â€œBad Guy,â€</a> wherein Stanâ€™s younger brother Matthew avenges his brotherâ€™s death.</p></div></div></div><div class="ExpandableContent__ButtonContainer-sc-1165iv-3 htndFn"><button class="Button__Container-rtu9rw-0 gZBeJn this song, Eminem corresponds with a crazed fan who becomes increasingly unhinged as the story progresses. This is one of his most well-received singles and was listed at #15 on [VH1](http://www.vh1.com)\'s [Top 100 Hip Hop Songs of All Time](http://ifelicious.com/2008/09/25/vh-1s-list-of-top-100-hip-hop-songs-of-all-time/).\\n\\nEminem intended for this song to be [a message to fans](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2R6yvdKPqA) who had written him disturbing letters indicating that they had taken [*The Slim Shady LP*](https://genius.com/albums/Eminem/The-slim-shady-lp-expanded-edition)\'s violent lyrics seriously. Another reason Em wrote this was to [\\\"make the critics who were saying things about [him] feel stupid.\\\"](https://youtu.be/AwLQxWiOTEI) His aim was to disprove those who felt he lacked talent and relied on shock value.\\n\\nThis song has cemented itself in history, with \\\"Stan\\\" being entered into the [Oxford Dictionary](http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/stan) as an informal noun. It is generally considered to be a portmanteau of \\\"stalker\\\" and \\\"fan,\\\" but Oxford defines the term as:\\n\\n>An overzealous or obsessive fan of a particular celebrity.\\n\\nIn a 2011 [Shade 45](https://m.siriusxm.com/shade45) appearance, Em [revealed that](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p_x0KBndWDI):\\n\\n> There was a verse where [Stan] got out of the water. He escaped and came to my house to kill me. Then I had to kill him first, [but] I missed him, and he was in the hospital for like three weeks. Then he was pissed off that I didn\'t write him get-well cards, so he came to kill me again, and in the last verse finally I just blew his head off.\\n\\nIn 2013, Eminem released a follow-up in the form of [\\\"Bad Guy,\\\"](http://genius.com/Eminem-bad-guy-lyrics) wherein Stan\'s younger brother Matthew avenges his brother\'s death.\",\"html\":\"<p>In this song, Eminem corresponds with a crazed fan who becomes increasingly unhinged as the story progresses.
